org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.bluetooth.ui

Class BluetoothDeviceListAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.MyViewHolder>
      • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.bluetooth.ui.BluetoothDeviceListAdapter

  • public class BluetoothDeviceListAdapter
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.MyViewHolder>
    Adapter for a simple RecyclerView list containing bluetooth devices. A BluetoothDevice can be added or updated using updateItem(BluetoothDevice, int, String) and passing the device itself, its status and an optional error message.
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.Device
      Class representing the device.
      static class  BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.MyViewHolder
      Class that contains all the Views in the list item root view needed to be accessed in onBindViewHolder(MyViewHolder, int)
      private class  BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.OnClickListener
      Inner click listener on list item root views.
      static interface  BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.OnItemClickListener
      Interface to handle clicks on the list items.

      • updateItem

        public void updateItem(@NonNull
                       android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device,
                       int status,
                       @Nullable
                       java.lang.String error)
        Updates or adds a new item to the list. Changes to the backing list are automatically notified to the adapter (no need to call RecyclerView.Adapter.notifyDataSetChanged(). If an item becomes BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.Device.STATUS_DISCONNECTED from BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.Device.STATUS_ERROR, its change is ignored in order to keep showing the error to the user.
        Parameters:
        device - the device to be added or updated.
        status - its new status (see BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.Device).
        error - optional error message.

      • insertInCorrectOrder

        private int insertInCorrectOrder(BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.Device item)
        Returns the position at which the item should be inserted in the mDataset to keep the ascending order.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be added in the list
        Returns:
        the position or -1 if the item is already inside the list.

      • setOnItemClickListener

        public void setOnItemClickListener(BluetoothDeviceListAdapter.OnItemClickListener listener)
